channel.title: Bat file deletes everything on my desktop
channel.description:
Well, so I downloaded this Left4Dead2 countdown clock. It shows when the demo will be released (and it didn't, which tops my unluck).
So, after it said L4D2 demo was released I clicked the uninstall button on the program.
It deleted all my files and shortcuts on the desktop.
Now, is there any way to get them back? And no, the files are not in the trash bin.

item.title: Bat file deletes everything on my desktop
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

System restore doesn’t restore files afaik.

Basically you fucked it. Go sue someone.

Read full topic
item.source: Bat file deletes everything on my desktop

item.title: Bat file deletes everything on my desktop
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Open up
C:\Users\UserName\Desktop
or
C:\Documents And Settings\UserName\Desktop
and move all your stuff to My Documents or something.

Read full topic
item.source: Bat file deletes everything on my desktop

item.title: Bat file deletes everything on my desktop
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

[quote=“cows_be_sacred, post:6, topic:311086”][quote author=PeterMan link=topic=407541.msg3009664#msg3009664 date=1256678525]

Click 'n drag from startup or find all the separate files in your C:\ drive and drag 'em.

I can’t quite say I understood that.

(Assuming you’re using windows)Click the start button and drag the images on your computer’s desktop. Or find all the separate files in your C:\ drive and drag them to the desktop.

I’m not looking after a chance to make new shortcuts. I’d like to know if I got restore the lost files.
[/quote]
It literately deleted your files?
Uh, system restore is the only thing I can think of…For windows anyways.[/quote]
Yeah it did.

Now, another problem. I click on the system restore program. Nothing shows up, I click again, it says it’s already open, I close it with task manager and try again, still no response. Any ideas?

EDIT: It popped up now on the 4th try.

Also: I feel like an idiot not thinking of System Restore. Thanks for reminding me :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 27, 2009, 04:19:13 pm[/size][hr]Ok, new issue. After I have used system restore. As soon as I log on, all my files and shortcuts on the desktop shows up, but suddenly like 12 of them dissapears. Inlcuding my school,picture,video and audio folder.

Anyone have any idea why this happens?

Read full topic
